com.wizarpos.devices.contactlesscard
Interface TargetCPU

All Superinterfaces:
Target
public interface TargetCPU
extends Target

This interface indicate the card is a CPU contactless card. The CPU card use APDU command to communicate with reader.

Since:
Author:
hans

Methods inherited from interface com.wizarpos.devices.contactlesscard.Target
connect, disconnect, getID, getIndex
 

Method Detail

sendRequest

byte[] sendRequest(byte[] buffer)
                   throws DeviceException
Sends a request to a specific target.

This is an synchronous method.

It is the responsibility of the underlying implementation to perform all necessary requests to "select", "deselect", "wake up"... targets before sending data.

Parameters:
buffer - Buffer containing the data to be transmitted
Returns:
the response data buffer
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException and also:
  • with code BAD_CONTROL_MODE - if no connect() has been performed or if disconnect() has been performed on this target
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException -
  • if buffer is null.

sendRequest

byte[] sendRequest(int operationID,
                   byte[] buffer)
                   throws DeviceException
Sends a dedicated command to the reader for a specific target.

This function might be used for specific purpose of sending commands to the reader in specific cases, such as setting keys or start authentication with the target.

This is an synchronous method.

It is the responsibility of the underlying implementation to perform all necessary requests to "select", "deselect", "wake up"... targets before sending data.

Parameters:
operationID - Specific operation identifier.
buffer - Buffer containing the specific data
Returns:
the response data buffer
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException and also:
  • with code BAD_CONTROL_MODE - if no connect() has been performed or if disconnect() has been performed on this target
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException -
  • if buffer is null.
  • if operationID is invalid.
